info.title: Artifact Repository Service API
info.description:
The Artifact Repository Service is a general purpose binary object management service that is used for creating, retrieving, updating and deleting binary blobs available to the System Management Services.  

The types of binary objects that can be managed with this service include,   but are not limited to, bootable images, docker images, OS packages, and firmware images.  Along with the binary images, metadata about using the artifact, such as versioning and  download location is also stored in the ARS.

ARS is used by System Administrators or Application Developers who want to create  utilities on top of the API. 
# Resources
## /artifacts  
  Manage an ArtifactRecord. Allows you to create an ArtifactRecord. The ArtifactRecord 
  stores the location of an artifact once it has been uploaded as well as the 
  associated metadata, described in the ArtifactRecord request body. 
  Required fields include the name of the artifact, the type of artifact 
  (limited to `generic`, `kernel`, and `initrd`), and the version.

## /uploads  
Manage an UploadRequest. Allows you to create an upload request for an  artifact and then upload the artifact to the ARS. You can also delete an upload  request by upload_id.
# Workflow  


 This workflow describes how you can upload an artifact in ARS: 

* POST /artifacts - Create a new artifact record in the ARS. Note **artifact_id**. 
* POST /uploads - Create a new upload request and use artifact_id from previous step. 
  Note **upload_id**. The value of upload_id is same as artifact_id. 

* PUT /uploads/{upload_id} - Upload an artifact to the upload request and use upload_id 
  from previous step.   
  
* GET /uploads/{upload_id} - Retrieve information about the upload request by upload_id. 
  This step is optional and may be used to confirm that the upload succeeded or to view 
  the current state of the upload.

* GET /artifacts/{artifact_id} - Retrieve the artifact record and get the download
  location (uri).


The default content type for the ARS API is "application/json". Unsuccessful API calls return a content type of "application/problem+json" as per RFC 7807.

parameters.name: artifact_id
parameters.description: The unique id of the artifact record

get.description: Download an artifact from the repository by artifact_id.

404.description: Requested resource does not exist. Re-run request with valid ID.

get.description: Liveness probe for ARS. This is used by Kubernetes to determine if ARS is responsive.
Readiness probe for ARS. This is used by Kubernetes to determine if ARS  is ready to accept requests.

200.description: ARS is ready to accept requests

500.description: ARS is not able to accept requests

get.description: Retrieve a list of artifact records.

items.description: An ArtifactRecord contains metadata used to access, and manage artifacts in the artifact repository.

atype.description:
Type of artifact.
* The kernel artifact is a bootable kernel image.
* The initrd artifact is an initial root file system that is mounted. The initrd is bound to the kernel and loaded as part of the kernel boot procedure.
* The generic artifact includes any type of artifact.

created.description: Time the artifact record was created

download_url.description: Download URL for the artifact. This field should not be by clients for downloading artifacts. Instead, use the value of the uri of this artifact along with the hostname of the server used to access ARS. This URL is subject to change and is not guaranteed to be accessible by all clients from all locations.

uri.description: URI of downloadable artifact. Use this value along with the hostname of the server used to access ARS. Clients using this URI should follow redirects to download the artifact.

500.description: An internal error occurred and the request could not be handled.

schema.description: An error response for RFC 7807 problem details.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. Focus on helping correct the problem, rather than giving debugging information.

errors.description: An object denoting field-specific errors. Only present on error responses when field input is specified for the request.

instance.description: A relative URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem

title.description: Short, human-readable summary of the problem, should not change by occurrence.

type.description: Relative URI reference to the type of problem which includes human readable documentation.

post.description:
Create a new artifact record in a repository. An artifact record stores metadata about a file artifact including its version and download location.
Request body contains minimum required fields in an ArtifactRecord. Successful completion returns completed ArtifactRecord, including a unique artifact_id, and the version and download location of the artifact. The artifact itself has not been uploaded yet. The artifact_id may be used in subsequent /uploads operations to actually request and perform an upload.

schema.description: An ArtifactRecordCreate contains metadata used to create artifacts in the artifact repository.

atype.description:
Type of artifact.
* The kernel artifact is a bootable kernel image.
* The initrd artifact is an initial root file system that is mounted. The initrd is bound to the kernel and loaded as part of the kernel boot procedure.
* The generic artifact includes any type of artifact.

Instead, use the value of the uri of this artifact along with the hostname of the server used to access ARS. get.description: Retrieve a list of upload requests.

artifact_id.description: ID of the artifact record that is associated with this upload request.

created.description: Time the upload request was created

state.description: State of the upload request. It can be the following - * created The upload request is created. The file is not uploaded yet. This happens after you run POST /uploads. * upload-processing The artifact is currently being uploaded. * upload-complete The artifact is uploaded. * error There is an error during upload.

url.description: Download URL of the uploaded file

post.description: Create a new upload request associated with an existing artifact_id. An artifact_id should be associated with a single upload_id; do not re-use an artifact_id with this operation.

artifact_id.description: ID of the artifact record that is associated with this upload request.

requestBody.description: Artifact record id to associate the upload with.

This happens after you run POST /uploads. * upload-processing The artifact is currently being uploaded. * upload-complete The artifact is uploaded. * error There is an error during upload.

put.description: Upload a file to an upload request. There are no restrictions on file type. You cannot replace an artifact after uploading it.

ArtifactRecordCreate.description: An ArtifactRecordCreate contains metadata used to create artifacts in the artifact repository.

atype.description:
Type of artifact.
* The kernel artifact is a bootable kernel image.
* The initrd artifact is an initial root file system that is mounted. The initrd is bound to the kernel and loaded as part of the kernel boot procedure.
* The generic artifact includes any type of artifact.
